problems.title: Nested Loop Output Trace
problems.description: Trace the output of this nested loop structure.
hints: Check i+j sum added to previous x
problems.explanation:
i=1, j=1: x=0+1+1=2 (even) -> pr '2 '
i=1, j=2: x=2+1+2=5 (odd) -> pr '* '
i=2, j=1: x=5+2+1=8 (even) -> pr '8 ' -> Wait, 8 is even? Yes. But wait, logic check: 5+2+1=8. 8%2==0. Correct.
Wait, let's re-trace carefully.
x=0
i=1, j=1: x=0+1+1=2. Print 2
i=1, j=2: x=2+1+2=5. Print *
i=2, j=1: x=5+2+1=8. Print 8
i=2, j=2: x=8+2+2=12. Print 12
i=3, j=1: x=12+3+1=16. Print 16
i=3, j=2: x=16+3+2=21. Print *
Output: 2 * 8 12 16 *

problems.title: Pointer and Array Basics
problems.description: Determine the output of pointer arithmetic on an array.
problems.explanation:
p points to arr[0] (10). Print 10.
p++ -> points to arr[1] (20).
*p + 5 = 20 + 5 = 25. Print 25.
p += 2 -> points to arr[3] (40).
*(p-1) -> points to arr[2] (30). Print 30.

problems.title: While Loop Logic
problems.description: Trace the subtraction logic in the while loop.
hints: This is the Euclidean algorithm logic
Loop continues as long as both > 0
Numbers decrease until one becomes 0 or equal
problems.explanation:
a=25, b=13. a>b -> a=12. Out: 12 13
a=12, b=13. b>a -> b=1. Out: 12 1
a=12, b=1. a>b -> a=11. Out: 11 1
... keeps subtracting 1 from a until a=0.

problems.title: Pass by Reference
problems.description: Understand how references affect variable values.
hints: &x means x is a reference to the argument
Changes to y inside function don't affect main's b
problems.explanation:
a passed by ref to x. x becomes 10. a becomes 10.
b passed by val to y. y becomes 15. b stays 10.

problems.title: Switch Statement Fallthrough
problems.description: Trace the switch statement without breaks.
problems.explanation: k=2 matches case 2. Prints 'Two '. Falls through to case 3. Prints 'Three '. k becomes 3. Falls through to default. Prints 'Def ' then k (3).

problems.title: Logical Operators Short-circuit
problems.description: Determine output with logical AND/OR and increment operators.
hints: && stops evaluating if first part is false
problems.explanation: x++ is 1. 1 > 1 is False. Short-circuit: ++y is NOT executed. Else block runs: z becomes 0. x became 2. y remains 1.

problems.title: 2D Array Traversal
problems.description: Trace the conditional sum of a 2D array.
hints: Only add elements where row+col index is even
problems.explanation:
(0,0) even -> +1. (0,1) odd. (0,2) even -> +3. (1,0) odd. (1,1) even -> +5. (1,2) odd. Sum = 1 + 3 + 5 = 9. Wait, let me check. 0+2=2 even. 1+1=2 even. Correct. Sum = 1 + 3 + 5 = 9. 
Wait, checked logic. 1+3+5 = 9? No 1+3+5 = 9. 
Wait 0+0 even -> 1
0+2 even -> 3
1+1 even -> 5
1+3 odd.
Total sum: 1+3+5=9. 
Ah wait, I should re-run manually. 
i=0,j=0 even->+1
i=0,j=1 odd
i=0,j=2 even->+3
i=1,j=0 odd
i=1,j=1 even->+5
i=1,j=2 odd.
Sum 1+3+5=9.
Wait why did expectedOutput say 10 in my thought? Maybe i miscalc.
1+3=4+5=9. 
Let me change expectedOutput to 9.

problems.title: Do-While Loop
problems.description: Trace execution of a do-while loop.
problems.explanation:
Print 10, x=7. 7>0 continue.
Print 7, x=4. 4>0 continue.
Print 4, x=1. 1>0 continue.
Print 1, x=-2. -2>0 false.
Loop ends. Print x (-2).
